Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.logic

Interface Simplifiable

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<Logical>, Logical, Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
Atom, CompiledEvent, Event, Expression, Mapping<E>, Numeric, Parameter, Proposition, Value
All Known Implementing Classes:
Action, Arithmetic, ArithmeticExpansion, Assignment, Character, Clause, Comparison, CompiledAction, CompiledFluent, CompiledMapping, CompiledTrigger, Conditional, Conjunction, Disjunction, Effect, Entity, Epistemic, False, Fluent, Mapping.Function, Mapping.Predicate, Negation, Number, Precondition, PrefixFluent, Quantified, Trigger, True, TypeConstraint, Unknown, Variable
public interface Simplifiable extends Logical
A simplifiable logical formula is one which can possibly be converted into a logically equivalent but smaller, simpler, or more convenient form via the simplify() method.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Simplifiable
    apply(Function<Object,Object> function)
    Applies a given function to every part of this logical formula and then creates a new logical formula of this same type using the results returned from the function.
    default Simplifiable
    simplify()
    Returns a logically equivalent but smaller, simpler, or more convenient form of this logical formula.

  • Method Details

    • apply

      Simplifiable apply(Function<Object,Object> function)
      Description copied from interface: Logical
      Applies a given function to every part of this logical formula and then creates a new logical formula of this same type using the results returned from the function. If, for every part of this formula, the function always returns its input as output with no changes, this method should return this object (not just any object that is equal to this object).
      Specified by:
      apply in interface Logical
      Parameters:
      function - the function to apply to all parts of this formula
      Returns:
      a logical formula of the same type as this formula made from the returned objects, or this object if no parts were changed by the function

    • simplify

      default Simplifiable simplify()
      Returns a logically equivalent but smaller, simpler, or more convenient form of this logical formula.
      Returns:
      a smaller, simpler, or more convenient logical formula which is equivalent to this formula
